page.title: 08Graduate employment scheme
page.content: A new scheme at the university is going to be sit up to help students to find jobs. It is hoped this agency scheme will be in operation at Bailrigg, Lancaster in 1986. the careers advisory service are setting up the scheme in a bid to help employers find graduates with the skells for the right jobs. The main topics of discussion in the area at present is the threat to the university of the proposed financial cuts by the Government. Over the next 10 years they will be awarding the university 2% each year less in their grant. This could lead to either the closure of the university, loss of departments or a reduction in numbers of academic staff. The loss of the university would be a catastrophic blow to the area.
